data.label: PROJECT NAME
description: The name of the project. The format is Financial Year/Project Name/Category

data.label: IN-DEPOT DATE
description: The date a product is due to arrive in depot

data.label: LAUNCH PHASE
description: The phase the product is due to be sent to stores

data.label: CATEGORY
description: The category the product is sold from

data.label: STATUS
description: The decision as to whether the product is going to progress or not:
* Go - progress
* No Go - no further work required
* Recycle - another submission within one week to agree if the product can Go, or not
* Hold - no further work required at this time, but the product may be resubmitted under another project where it matches the brief

data.label: ROUTE TO MARKET
description: The route to market that has been assigned to the product. Within the P%26PP there are three possible routes to market:
* Sourced
* Standard
* Supplier Led

data.label: UPC
description: This is the Unique Product Code that makes up the barcode on the product packaging.
For new lines, this is to be added by the Commercial Planner in the finalise stage. For existing lines, this is to be added by the Product Developer when setting up the product.

data.label: PRODUCT TITLE
description: Product title for on pack which will also be used for part of product file name. Must;
* Be a maximum of 5 words
* Not use symbols, as FIND fails the product UPC generation with these included (e.g. use 'and' instead of '%26')
The Product Developer is accountable for the completion and accuracy of this field however it can also be completed by the Sub-Copy writer.
This information will also be used to create the Range Board by GSP.

data.label: PRODUCT SUBTITLE
description: Product sub-title for on pack. Must be a maximum of 15 words.
The Product Developer is accountable for the completion and accuracy of this field however it can also be completed by the Sub-Copy writer.
This information will also be used to create the Range Board by GSP.

data.label: COMMENTS
description: Provide any comments related to reasons for title/ sub-title changes

data.label: PRODUCT NEEDSTATE
description: The needstate defines the 'requirement of the customer that the product is fulfilling'.
Whilst the Product Developer is accountable for completing this field, Range Planners can offer insight to support the selection.
If you want to add a needstate to the list contact Customer Insight Unit who own the master list. Once agreed, contact IT Services to add the value to the drop down list provided.

data.label: FIND PRODUCT FILETYPE
description: This defines if the product is a single component or multi component product.
* Standard -  a single component product.
* Parent - a multi component product (if parent is selected you will need to provide the details of any child products)
* Existing - an existing product (if selected, no new specification is required but the existing specificaiton should be included in the recipe page of the parent specification)

data.label: CRITICAL PATH REQUIRED
description: The correct path to be attached to the product based on the reason for change and decision tree.
This will also define who is in the approval loop apart from LSPi which will be confirmed by the International Packaging Requirements field.

data.label: REASONS FOR CHANGE
description: When a product is being introduced or changing a reason for change is to be selected.:
The choices are
* N - New
* NE - New Event
* SV - Size Variant
* UG - Upgrade
* RP - Representation
* RI - Reintroduction
* NSupp - New Supplier
* NSC - New selling channel
* Minor - Minor amends
* CF - Bespoke Child File
* Elim - Elimination

data.label: HERO PRODUCT
description: Hero products are ones which may be used for advertising

data.label: PRODUCT QUALITY STORY
description: Product Quality stories are long term claims that we can make consistently across the business or ranges. E.g select farm protein, speciality grade coffee.
Complete this field with all the quality stories that are applicable to the product. i.e. Select Farm, [Protein type], [Country].

The claims must be captured in the claims section of FIND. New claims will be added once approved by the SME. Approved claims can be found on CONNECT in the Corporate Food Packaging Policy (CFPP 4 BOP) document.

data.label: TIER
description: This defines the quality %26 pricing tier the product is being developed for.
* Good: Entry level for M%26S. Simple Ingredients %26 recipes. Basic packaging. Usually includes Waitrose Essentials, Tesco and Sainsburys core ranges.
* Better: Differentiates vs. Good through improved recipes, ingredients, process, packaging (usually one or more). Usually includes Waitrose core and top tier Tesco and Sainsbury ranges.

* Best: Crafted Luxury - highly premium products. Only relevant in Gifting, BWS, Meat %26 Fish (e.g. Wagyu, caviar), Deli, Cheese %26 Dairy. Best Eating, restaurant quality food. Structural packaging. Includes Waitrose 1, no presence of Tesco, Sainsbury own label.
More information on this field can be found in the P%26PP Guide.

data.label: PRINTER TYPE
description: Will the printer be from the A list or a Supplier Managed Printer (SMP). If no printer is required select None.

data.label: SMP APPROVED
description: Confirm if the Supplier Managed Printer has been approved or not. More information on SMP approval process can be found on CONNECT

data.label: PRINTER NAME
description: Confirm the name of the Printer being used

data.label: PRINTED PACKAGING TYPE
description: This field defines the type of packaging that requires to be printed e.g. sleeve, jar etc.
Select 'Multiple' If more than one packaging component is to be printed. The details of all the components must then be defined in the 'Multiple Artwork' section

data.label: CONSUMER PACKAGING TYPE
description: This field defines the type of packaging the end product that the consumer buys will be in.
Select 'Loose' if there is no packaging

data.label: PHOTOGRAPHY REQUIRED
description: Confirm if photograhy is required for the design
This will define if a Home Economy Brief is required to be completed by the Supplier and approved by the Product Developer and if a photoshoot needs to be booked

data.label: DESIGN ROUTE
description: The design that will be applied to the packaging e.g. Christmas Black or the specific Healthy Design

data.label: SECONDARY DESIGN ROUTE
description: Secondary design for products with a Design created for an Event e.g. Christmas (defined in Design Route) but also a Plant Kitchen product (defined in Secondary Design Route).

data.label: FOP REQ LOGOS
description: Define the logos required on FOP based on the hierarchy of the Product and Packaging Brief and the Guideline Reference Document (GRD). If no FOP logos are required complete the field with N/A.

data.label: CUTTER TYPE
description: Cutter type defines if a new or already approved cutter will be used for the product.
Select 'Multiple' If there are multiple printed packaging components for the product and then complete the details in the 'Multiple Artwork' section
Select 'None' If there is no printed packaging for this product

data.label: CUTTER REFERENCE (FOR ALL PRINTED PACKAGING COMPONENTS)
description: Record the Cutter reference number.

If there are multiple packaging components, add the primary packaging component cutter reference in this field and the details of the cutter type and cutter references for all of the remaining packaging components in the 'Multiple Artwork' section

data.label: DESIGN CONCEPT HANDOVER
description: Record the date for design masters handover

data.label: FTP Date
description: The File to Print (FTP) date is the date that printers require the file to ensure printed packaging is delivered on time.
If there are multiple printed packaging components then the FTP date provided must be the earliest FTP date.

data.label: WEIGHT/VOLUME
description: The actual weight or volume of the product as it will be declared on pack

data.label: UNIT OF MEASURE
description: The unit of measure for the product as it will be declared on pack - g, kg, ml, l

data.label: SUPPLIER NAME (AS DECLARED ON FIND)
description: The name of the site that will manufacturer the product.
This needs to be the name as defined in FIND so that when the product file is created the correct supplier is invited to the specification.

data.label: SUPPLIER SITE CODE
description: The site code of the manufacturer as it is defined in FIND %26 SAP e.g. 1234

data.label: NEW SUPPLIER
description: Confirm whether the supplier is New to M%26S and therefore requires to be set up in M%26S and Ocado.

data.label: MASTER VENDOR
description: The master vendor is the supplier whose information should be used for SAP. Yes will be selected for all single supplied products and the main supplier for dual supplied products.
If Yes is selected on a new version of a dual supplied product then this will become the Master Vendor over the previously selected YES supplier

data.label: SOLD IN OCADO
description: Select Yes if this product is to be sold on Ocado

data.label: SOLD IN FRANCE
description: This field defines the International packaging requirements for the product. A value from the dropdown list must be selected by a member of the International Foods Team and only applies to the French market.
The field needs to be completed within 1 week of the Creative Gate Summary Meeting to ensure the details in the Product File are correct.

Changes to International requirements can’t take place on the PAL once the FIND pack copy approval loop has been started or completed – Contact GSP Schawk International Manager (Claire Chamrong) for guidance.
The dropdown list includes:
*Yes - selected when a NEW product is to be sold in France
*No - selected when a NEW product is NOT to be sold in France
*Change to Yes - selected when a product is going through a change and France now would like to sell it.
*Change to No - selected when a product is going through a change and France no longer want to sell it.
*Existing Bespoke France - identifies that a product going through a change is already being sold in France in bespoke packaging.
*Existing Bespoke France - identifies that a product going through a change is already being sold in France in bespoke packaging.
*New Bespoke France - identifies that a product is NEW to being sold in France and this will be in bespoke packaging.
Full details of the dropdown list can be found in a document in the toolkit called P%26PP Guide to completing International Requirements field in the PAL

data.label: MCR
description: Minimal Credible Range - If Yes is selected the product will be in all stores

data.label: WHERE IS THE PRODUCT TO BE SOLD?

values: In Store M&S and TBC Ocado

description: Defines where the product is due to be sold

data.label: FTO/EBO
data.tooltip: FTO = Food to Order/EBO = Entertain by Ocado
description: Select Yes and the correct selling location if the product will be sold through Food to order or Entertain by Ocado. Select No if neither is applicable.

data.label: COST PRICE - EX WORKS (OCADO)

errorMessages.patternMessage: Enter numerical value and characters only

description: Shared M%26S and Ocado Indicative ex works cost price. Negotiated on the combined M%26S and Ocado indicative volumes, agreed at Creative stage. Any substantial changes to cost price that significantly impact margin and means a new RSP need to be agreed with Trading Manager/Head of Trading. This field will be shared with Ocado post creative gate. The PAL is not updated with price changes agreed at Finalise Stage.

data.label: GROSS COST PRICE (M&S CONSIDERING OCADO VOLUMES)

errorMessages.requiredMessage: GROSS COST PRICE (M&S CONSIDERING OCADO VOLUMES) is mandatory

description: Indicative M%26S gross cost price of product delivered to M%26S, negotiated on combined M%26S and Ocado volumes, agreed at Creative stage. Any substantial changes to cost price that significantly impact margin and means a new RSP need to be agreed with Trading Manager/Head of Trading. The PAL is not updated with price changes agreed at Finalise Stage.

data.label: GROSS COST PRICE (M&S VOLUME ONLY)

errorMessages.requiredMessage: GROSS COST PRICE (M&S VOLUME ONLY) is mandatory

description: Indicative M%26S gross cost price of product delivered to M%26S, negotiated on M%26S volume only, agreed at Creative stage. Any substantial changes to cost price that significantly impact margin and means a new RSP need to be agreed with Trading Manager/Head of Trading. The PAL is not updated with price changes agreed at Finalise Stage.

data.label: AGREED COST PRICE CURRENCY
description: The currency that the supplier will be paid in.
Currency rates are; GBP 1, EUR 0.9, USD 0.7. If the currency rate is not correct then contact M%26S IT Support (One M%26S Food Platform) with the correct value to be updated.

data.label: SELLING PRICE
description: Indicative Selling Price of Product agreed at Creative Stage. Any changes to selling  price during Finalise stage need to be agreed with Trading Manager/Head of Trading. The PAL is not updated with price changes agreed at Finalise Stage.
Price rounding rules to be followed - see document  Price and Promotion Policy in the P%26PP toolkit.

data.label: PRICE STICKERED PRODUCTS
description: Due to price premiums on products for London and Franchise stores, national prices will need to be held on price stickered products. This flag will allow the P%26P Opts team to hold prices and ensure we are trading legally across the M%26S estate

data.label: PRICE PER X g/kg/ml

values: Single item e.g. one bread loaf

description: Shelf edge tickets legally require a specific price per X weight e.g. £10 per kg, X= kg. Select the correct weight for each product from the drop down list.

There is a legal definition of the weight to be selected which is defined based on the product type. To ensure that the correct value is selected please refer to the document Price and Promotion Policy in the P%26PP toolkit

data.label: VAT - BUYING TAX INDICATOR
description: The product VAT rate is to be selected from the list of values.
Code 0 - 0%
Code 1 - 20%
Code 2 - 5%
Code 9 - Mixed (any number from 0-20%)
If mixed rate is selected then the actual % is to be stated in the VAT comment box.
Buying and selling rates will be the same, except for in categories F11, F75, F87 and F90 where they may differ.

data.label: VAT - SELLING TAX INDICATOR
description: The product VAT rate is to be selected from the list of values.
Code 0 - 0%
Code 1 - 20%
Code 2 - 5%
Code 9 - Mixed (any number from 0-20%)
If mixed rate is selected then the actual % is to be stated in the VAT comment box.
Buying and selling rates will be the same, except for in categories F11, F75, F87 and F90 where they may differ.

data.label: VAT TEAM CONFIRMED
description: If No selected, VAT team to leave a comment in the VAT Comment box

data.label: VAT COMMENT
description: Add comments as required from the VAT fields

data.label: MARGIN
description: This is a system calculated field based on cost price, selling price and agreed cost price currency inputted in the relevant fields.

data.label: MPQ (MINIMUM PRODUCTION QUANTITY)
description:
MPQ is the minimum number of units (volume) that can be ordered before production can go ahead. It is most applicable to Ambient, Frozen, Ocado.
                It is defined by the supplier and the buyer and Supply Chain will use this field to assist with order planning.

data.label: MOQ (MINIMUM ORDER QUANTITY) AMBIENT ONLY
description: AMBIENT: MOQ to be 1 pallet and should be populated in the PAL. If a higher MOQ is requested by the Supplier, Buyer with support from Supply chain to assess E2E cost impact (Forecasted demand/ Working capital/ Cost of Capital %26 Storage).
Supply chain use this field to assist with order planning out of the Q system. This is also relevant to Ocado %26 M%26S Logistics to define supply route to Ocado (Direct or Indirect).
FROZEN/CHILL: No requirement

data.label: FIXED BUY
description: Fixed Buy is a product bought in fixed volume and price for a certain time period. Fixed buys fall into the following groups:
* Yes - AYR: All year round lines that are seasonally packed or produced at defined intervals throughout the year e.g. tinned tomatoes, wine
* Yes - Commodity: Highly commoditised products which M%26S buy in fixed volume to mitigate cost price fluctuations e.g. tuna
* Yes - Seasonal/ Event: Seasonal and events based products e.g. Christmas turkeys, Halloween lines

data.label: MAXIMUM VOLUME AVAILABLE
description: Add details of the maximum volume available at a defined frequency. E.g. 10, 000 units per week or per month. This should confirm max volumes available to deliver to both M%26S and Ocado.
It could be constrained due to investment requirements or supply capacity or because it is a Fixed Buy line or annual reserve for wines

data.label: FIXED BUY COMMITMENT DEADLINE

errorMessages.requiredMessage: FIXED BUY COMMITMENT DEADLINE is mandatory

description: Add the latest date where the buyer needs to commit to the fixed buy volumes with the M%26S supplier. For wines this equivalent to reserve commitment

data.label: ORDER LEADTIME SUPPLY CHAIN

errorMessages.requiredMessage: ORDER LEADTIME SUPPLY CHAIN is mandatory

description: This field is to be completed when the supply route is Indirect - Ocado (lines Ocado are buying from M%26S which are in Bradford).
The value in the field confirms the number of days to receive stock into Bradford from the supplier once an order is placed.

data.label: UPT
description: Indicative Units per tray or units per carton.
The PAL will not be updated if this value changes.
A travel test must be completed and approved for each UPT value being ordered by the Buyer.
For FTO the value should be 1 if a different value is required it must be agreed by the Cateogry Buyer with the Online Trading Manager.

data.label: TRAY SELLING VALUE
description: This is a system calculated field based on the cost price of one product and UPT value

data.label: TRAY COST VALUE
description: This is a system calculated field based on the selling price of one product and UPT value

data.label: PROMO FOR LAUNCH
description: Indicate whether the product will be launched on promotion or not

data.label: PRICING POLICY

values: Align to family group/rest of range pricing architecture

description: Pricing Policy defines the retailer who is being tracked on price comparison for the product and defines the allowed variation from their selling price.
For more information on Pricing Criteria refer to document Price and Promotion Policy in the P%26PP toolkit.

data.label: PRODUCT COMPARISON
description: Add details of competitors product that are the most comparable product to the concept (if a comparison exists)
Input Product title as per described on the relevant web site for Tesco, Waitrose and Sainsbury.
This field must be updated at the Finalise Gate with new comparable products.

data.label: PROPOSED NUMBER OF STORES

errorMessages.requiredMessage: PROPOSED NUMBER OF STORES is mandatory

description: At creative stage the indicative number of stores the line will plan to be launched in is defined. The field is updated at the supplier finalise gate with the actual number of stores the product will be launched in.

data.label: MODEL PRODUCT
description: Provide the name and UPC of the product that should be used as a model for this product.

data.label: SUCCESS CRITERIA = ROV PER STORE

errorMessages.requiredMessage: SUCCESS CRITERIA = ROV PER STORE is mandatory

description: The number of units that are planned to be sold in any M%26S store in one week

data.label: AVERAGE WEEKLY SALES - M&S
description: The Indicative weekly sales for the product in M%26S is auto calculated based on Selling Price, Proposed number of Stores and Success Criteria

data.label: AVERAGE WEEKLY VOLUME - M&S
description: The indicative number of units to be sold in one week in M%26S is auto calculated based on Selling Price and Average Weekly Sales - M%26S

errorMessages.requiredMessage: AVERAGE WEEKLY VOLUME - OCADO is mandatory

data.label: SEASONAL SALES & VOLUME
description: For products with a seasonal or fixed buy add details of the £ sales and volume (number of units)

data.label: CATCH WEIGHT/ FIXED WEIGHT
description: Is the product catchweight or fixed weight or Loose, or  N/A.
A value is selected from the dropdown
For Loose items sold by weight they must select Loose/Catchweight
For Loose items sold by individual unit they must select Loose/Fixed Weight
This feeds into SAP and determines how product sells in tills, on scales etc.

data.label: FINISHED GOODS DIMENSIONS HEIGHT (CM)

errorMessages.requiredMessage: FINISHED GOODS DIMENSIONS HEIGHT(CM) is mandatory

description: The height in cm of the product %26 packaging when sitting on the store shelf
The maximum height is 20cm or a reduced number of shelves is required. Specific category requirements for max height are:
Groceries – 14cm,
Soft Drinks – bottles: 31cm
Cans: 16cm,
Wines – 32cm,
Beers – Cans: 15cm
Bottles: 25cm.

data.label: FINISHED GOODS DIMENSIONS WIDTH (CM)

errorMessages.requiredMessage: FINISHED GOODS DIMENSIONS WIDTH(CM) is mandatory

description: The width in cm of the product and packaging when sitting on the store shelf.
Products to fill the M%26S shelf as efficiently as possible.
Chill lines to be divisible into 60cm for width without creating a gap, and considering a shelf depth of 42cm.
Ambient lines to be divisible into 124cm for width (unless a key product for trade/event space when it needs to be divisible into 100cm) and considering a shelf depth of 50cm.

data.label: FINISHED GOODS DIMENSIONS DEPTH (CM)

errorMessages.requiredMessage: FINISHED GOODS DIMENSIONS DEPTH(CM) is mandatory

description: The depth in cm of the product and packaging when sitting on the store shelf.
Products to fill the M%26S shelf as efficiently as possible.
Chill lines to be divisible into 60cm for width without creating a gap, and considering a shelf depth of 42cm.
Ambient lines to be divisible into 124cm for width (unless a key product for trade/event space when it needs to be divisible into 100cm) and considering a shelf depth of 50cm.

data.label: ORIENTATION (SELECT BEST SHAPE)
description: The shape of the product, if the exact value isn't provided select the Best Fit for the product.

data.label: SRP REQUIRED
description: SRP Is a shelf/store ready packaging. Select Yes or No to confirm if one is required or not for the product. If yes is selected also complete the dimensions in the next fields.

data.label: SRP DIMENSIONS HEIGHT (CM)
description: If SRP is required confirm the dimensions for height in cm

data.label: SRP DIMENSIONS WIDTH (CM)
description: If SRP is required confirm the dimensions for width in cm

data.label: SRP DIMENSIONS DEPTH (CM)
description: If SRP is required confirm the dimensions for width in cm

data.label: PRODUCT LIFE (Nights)
description: Add indicative shelf life in nights of the product based on knowledge of processes and similar products.

The final shelf life is agreed at  finalise gate, post factory trial assessment for safety and quality. The shelf life is recorded and approved in the basic specification. The PAL is not updated. For wines add information on drink within recommendation

data.label: PLAN A ATTRIBUTE(S) / SUSTAINABILITY

values: AISE Charter for Sustainable Cleaning (for homecare products only)
Attribute Type Attribute Definition Application / Use Owner
British Beef (if previously sourced from countries at risk of deforestation)
Compostable Biobased Polymers (OK Compost HOME Approved)
Food waste reduction (through Packaging or Processing)
Free Range Eggs (where >10% of the product)
Member of an M&S-approved Sustainable Wine Scheme
Milk Pledge Plus (inc. Dairy Health & Welfare)
Recycled Content from an M&S Recycling Partnership
Reduced fat / Sugar / Salt / Saturated Fat
Significant carbon footprint reduction through bulk shipping of wine
Validated by M&S as a Silver or Gold factory on the How We Do Business scorecard

description: Add all Plan / Sustainability attributes that apply to the product. A detailed document outlining the attributes is available on CONNECT called Plan A %26 Sustainability Credentials Document and will include requirements for attributes such as:Fairtrade, Suitable for freezing, 3rd party accreditation, Recycling statements, Storage statements to reduce Food Waste

data.label: BANNED INGREDIENTS FOR INTERNATIONAL
description: There are ingredients/packaging materials  that are banned in certain countries - the ingredient or none should be selected from list.

data.label: SPS CERTIFICATION TYPE REQUIRED FOR EXPORT

optionsRef.id: SPS CERTIFICATION TYPE REQUIRED FOR EXPORT
values: HIGH RISK FOOD OF NON ANIMAL ORIGIN
EHC - PET FOOD OTHER THAN CANNED

description: The type of product being sold based on a decision tree as to whether a product is subject to sanitary or phytosanitary control. The document named Brexit FIND update Guidelines – vs 1 03.12.2020 and Brexit Questions – Product classification Decision Tree is available in CONNECT to support the classification and the information will be completed in the questions section in FIND as part of Basic Spec approval.
* EHC – a finshed product containing product of animal origin, the specific VET certificate required will be defined in the FIND specification
* PHYTO – a plant-based product that has not been processed, peeled or diced.
* NON-VET – product not subject to SPS control
* EU WINE- "as it says on the tin"
* NON-EU WINE- "as it says on the tin"
* ENGLISH WINE - "as it says on the tin"
* PET FOOD – Canned or Other "as it says on the tin"
* NON FOOD.

data.label: LEGAL STATUS
description: This field identifies which countries the product is legally  suitable for sale in.
The list of banned products is defined in the Export Compliance Guidelines available on CONNECT

data.label: MULTIPLE COUNTRY OF ORIGINS
description: Select Yes if the country of origin stated on pack may vary due to either seasonality, or due to a contingency supplier
This field needs to be updated at the finalise gate if necessary

data.label: FEASIBILITY: OVERALL SCORE & LEVEL
description: This field defines the Feasibility score and level of risk. Supplier complete the P%26PP Feasibility template document available in the P%26PP toolkit, following the instructions and then transfer the outcome of the assessment to this field based on the overall feasibility score and RAG

data.label: IS THE DATE CODE (UB/BB/BBE) VISIBLE ON THE PACK OR OUTER CARTON OR TRAY
description: Ocado need to have easy visibility of the date code. Confirms if a date code is present on either the pack, the outer carton or the tray.

Select YES if either/both the product packaging or outer case has a printed date code on them e.g. a tin of tuna with date code (UB/BB/BBE) printed directly on the tin but not the label; basic fruit / veg with date code (UB/BB/BBE) shown on the tray but not the product label; Multipack crisps with date code (UB/BB/BBE) on packaging %26 case; Yoghurts with date code (UB/BB/BBE) on packaging %26 case / tray
Select NO if there is no date code e.g. Wines, Aluminium Foil, Shower gel, other Homecare lines (excluding pet food)

data.label: RANGE ACTIVITY CODE (RAC)
description: This is the code provided by the SRD Ops team when the range change is booked in

data.label: HFSS
description: Defines if a product is High in Fat, Salt or Sugar and would therefore be subject to specific requirements

data.label: CONFIRMED PRODUCT TITLE FOR BROCHURE/ WEBSITE
CONFIRMED COPY FOR FRONT LABEL (I.E. VINTAGE COUNTRY OF ORIGIN, ETC)
GHOST (SELF SUPPLY)/SUPER GHOST (RAW MATERIAL FROM OTHER HOSPITALITY CATEGORY) MASTER INFORMATION (UPC %26 PRODUCT TITLE)
HOSPITALITY GHOST (SELF SUPPLY)/SUPER GHOST (RAW MATERIAL FROM OTHER HOSPITALITY CATEGORY) MASTER INFORMATION (UPC %26 PRODUCT TITLE)
DUTY PAID %26 DELIVERED COST PER UNIT
UK VAT - SELLING TAX ADJ - FOR CALCULATION, NOT  A FIELD THAT IS FILLED IN
TRAY TYPE (AMBIENT - ORANGE TRAY, CHILLED - METRIC OR FULL TRAY)
ESTIMATED MINIMUM COST TO FILL (CORE SPACE ONLY)
SEASONAL BUY NO. OF WEEKS ON THE SHELF
FIND SPEC SIGNED OFF %26 READY FOR CYBAKE UPLOAD
LOGOS - NUT ON EVERYTHING / VEG WHERE RELEVENT
LATEST DATE STOCK SHOULD BE ASSIGNED
TOP SHELF ONLY LOOSE PRODUCTS CONTAINING NUTS/SESAME
COUNTRY WHERE ASSIGNED OR COUNTRY OF ASSIGNMENT
SHORT CODE TO BE ADDED TO CYBAKE SYSTEM
CONSUME WITHIN (WHEN IT ARRIVES IN STORE MIN LIFE)
CYBAKE SPEC CREATED AND READY FOR REVIEW
